snippet: Ming Du, a restaurant in the garment district, has had trouble with its report card from the city’s Health Department. Here’s to hoping it gets an A and keeps it.
abstract: Lawrence Downes The City Life column extols the virtues of tiny Ming Du, an inexpensive restaurant in the garment district that has been closed down by the city's Health Department; hopes that Ming Du's owners are able to improve its rating and reopen.
lead_paragraph: Ming Du, a restaurant in the garment district, has had trouble with its report card from the city’s Health Department. Here’s to hoping it gets an A and keeps it.

headline.seo: The Little Chinese Restaurant That (I Wish) Could
headline.main: The Little Restaurant That (I Wish) Could
headline.print_headline: The Little Restaurant That (I Wish) Could
